data.title: 4 Decades of Purple Rain: Revolution To Celebrate at First Avenue
data.meta_description: Celebrate 40 years of Purple Rain at First Ave in June
data.text:
We're getting old, and this is a Sign O' the Times: members of Prince's Revolution will reunite at First Avenue to celebrate the 40th anniversary of his iconic album Purple Rain.

The shows will take place Friday, June 21st and Saturday, June 22nd. Tickets go on sale Friday, April 12th (2024) at 11am.

40 Years of Purple Rain

Purple Rain was released on June 25th, 1984 as the soundtrack to the film Purple Rain. It became Prince's first #1 album on the Billboard Top 200 and stayed at the top for 24 consecutive weeks.

The album won Grammys for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal and for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media, plus an Academy Award for Best Original Song Score.

Purple Rain has since been ranked number 8 (OUTRAGE) on Rolling Stone magazine's "500 Greatest Albums of All Time" in 2020, and added to the Library of Congress National Recording Registry.

"I Would Die 4 U", "Baby, I'm a Star", and "Purple Rain" were recorded live at First Avenue on August 3rd, 1983.

What Does "Purple Rain" Mean?

"When there's blood in the sky â€“ red and blue = purple ... purple rain pertains to the end of the world and being with the one you love and letting your faith/god guide you through the purple rain." ~ Prince

The Current Revolution Band Lineup

Lisa Coleman - keyboards and piano

Wendy Melvoin - guitar

Bobby Z - drums

BrownMark - bass

Dr. Fink - keyboards

H/T: Kare 11
